qas.question: Even though Tajikistan has freedom of the press, what is the problem with it?

answers.text: access is blocked to local and foreign websites including avesta.tj, Tjknews.com, ferghana.ru, centrasia.ru

qas.question: What is not tolerated by the government in respect to media?

answers.text: no public criticism of the regime is tolerated

qas.question: What is not covered by local media?

answers.text: all direct protest is severely suppressed

qas.question: Access is granted to local and foreign what?
Criticism of what is often tolerated?
What often receives coverage in the local media?

context: Freedom of the press is ostensibly officially guaranteed by the government, but <a0_0><b4_0>independent press outlets<b4_0/> remain restricted<a0_0/>, as does a substantial amount of web content. According to the Institute for War & Peace Reporting, <a1_0>access is blocked to local and foreign <b5_0>websites<b5_0/> including avesta.tj, Tjknews.com, ferghana.ru, centrasia.ru<a1_0/> and journalists are often obstructed from reporting on controversial events. In practice, <a2_0>no public <b7_0>criticism of <b6_0>the regime<b7_0/><b6_0/> is tolerated<a2_0/> and <a3_0>all direct protest is severely suppressed<a3_0/> and does not receive coverage in the local media.
